intro: Gilia mohavensis, commonly known as the Mohave gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky habitats. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is also known for its role in supporting local pollinators and contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
